title: Steamtown National Historic Site: Photos & Multimedia
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Photos & Multimedia             Photos & Multimedia       Photos and Video  Can I take photos and video of my visit to the park? In the museums? On the trains? Sure - but SAFETY rules! Especially in today's digital age, capture your special memories with photos or video at our unique industrial heritage site! In some instances, though, a Special Use Permit may be required. Generally, permits are not required for: - Visitors using cameras and/or recording devices for their own personal use; - Sound technicians and film or video news crews at breaking news events; - National Park Service filming or photography, Department of the Interior Audiovisual Center filming, or filming/photography done pursuant to a cooperative agreement or contract.  "I have a project idea to do a photo/video shoot at the park for a potential client. How do I arrange this?" "I produce documentary films and want to bring a crew to film at your park, interview personnel, etc. How do I make arrangements?" Click here to learn the answers, or phone 570-340-5182 during regular business hours, Monday-Friday, 8:30 am - 4 pm, for more info!
